q: Eric Schmidt were on the call Thursday with analysts. The search giant's stock was up 1.3 percent in after-hours trading. Google's stock price has climbed by about 6 percent over the past month, and since Google stock is not selling off, it tells you the market is very happy with the report, said Rick Munarriz, a senior analyst at The Motley Fool. BGC Partners analyst Colin Gillis said Google experienced tremendous growth under Eric Schmidt , becoming a search and advertising powerhouse, but the company also arguably experienced a number of missteps and missed opportunities. A case can also be made that the company has not built any new material revenue streams, was late to building for the mobile market, has no effective social solutions, overbuilt its headcount and placed itself in the crosshairs of government regulators, Gillis said. Danny Sullivan , editor-in-chief of technology blog SearchEngineLand.com, said Google's biggest challenges now were to ''prove that they've got their Mojo back and that nobody needs to fear them.''

The news of the change rocked Silicon Valley, with analysts and company insiders offering varying theories. Some said Mr. Eric Schmidt was tired of the day-to-day hassles of management. Mr. Eric Schmidt said in the interview, I would tell you, frankly, a decade is a long time to be a C.E.O., and Larry will discover this. Others say Mr. Page always planned to re-assert his authority at some point. ''Larry has wanted to be C.E.O., so that's not a surprise,'' said a former Google sales executive

Dean Takahasi van Venturebeat stelt het nog scherper: Op een gegeven moment kan Steve Ballmer niet meer de schuld op mensen binnen de organisatie schuiven en moet hij zelf de verantwoordelijkheid nemen. Dat hebben we eerder gezien bij Nokia en AMD. De kans lijkt klein dat met het aanstellen van nieuwe topmanagers de aandeelhouders direct tevreden gesteld worden.
